FIGREF0.text: 23 first confirmed case of an infection with SARS-CoV-2 in New York State. 1 Since 24 then, as of April 2, 2020 New York has become the U.S. State with the most 25 SARS-CoV-2 infections and deaths, and there have been over 80,000 SARS-CoV-26 2 infections in New York State and over 2,000 deaths.

FIGREF1.text: Design: We used data that were concurrently collected at a large hospital 29 group in New York State between March 2 and March 29, 2020. Routine SARS-30 CoV-2 testing was not performed. Data included the week of admission, the 31 pregnancy status of the patient, and the SARS-CoV-2 status (positive or negative).

FIGREF3.text: The table and the figure show the SARS-CoV-2 positive cases by 37 pregnancy status and weeks. There was a total of 21,980 admissions at 14 hospitals 38 during the 4-week period, 3,064 were pregnant or postpartum, and 19,299 were not 39 pregnant. 40 The SARS-CoV-2 infection status for pregnant and postpartum patients increased 41 from 0.14% of all hospital admissions in week 1 to 5.65% of all hospital 42 admissions in week 4 (RR 14.81 95% CI: 2.07-107.38). The SARS-CoV-2 status 43 for non-pregnant patients rose from 1.21% of all hospital admissions in week 1 to 44 56.79% of all hospital admissions in week 4 (RR: 46.99 95%CI: 36.72-60.15).
